sections.heading: What is 12A Registration?
content: 12A Registration ensures that your NGO does not pay income tax on surplus income, provided it is used for charitable purposes.

points: All surplus income can be used for charitable activities

sections.heading: What is 80G Registration?
content: 80G registration allows donors to your NGO to claim tax deductions on their donations, making it easier to attract funds.

points: Donors can claim 50% or 100% tax deductions depending on category
Encourages more donations from individuals and corporates
Required for most CSR and corporate funding
NGOs working in areas like Education, Medical Aid, Poverty Alleviation, Environment, Social Welfare, Religious & Charitable Activities

list.title: For 12A Registration
points: Details of trustees, directors, or members
Step 1: Prepare all required documents ensuring your NGO's goals are aligned with charitable purposes
Step 2: File online applications via the Income Tax portal using correct forms
Step 3: Verification by Income Tax Department, may ask for additional info
Step 4: Receive 12A and/or 80G registration certificates after approval
Usually 30 to 60 business days, depending on case complexity and department workload
12A Registration: Valid indefinitely as long as compliance is maintained
80G Registration: Valid for a fixed period and may require renewal
Use funds only for charitable purposes
Avoid activities contrary to charitable objectives to prevent cancellation
Do all NGOs have to register with 12A? Yes, otherwise surplus income is taxed.
Can a new NGO apply immediately? Yes, registrations can be applied as soon as NGO is formed.
Is 80G registration mandatory? No, but highly recommended to attract donations.
Can religious groups apply for 80G? Yes, though limits may apply on donations for religious activities.
Can registrations be revoked? Yes, for misuse or non-compliance.
Can NGOs receive foreign donations with 12A/80G? No, separate FCRA registration is needed.
Ensure charitable objectives are correctly documented
